659373047.name: love this beach!
659373047.author: a TripAdvisor user
659373047.reviewBody: We return to Los Ayala because the town is small, friendly and easy to get to.  The beach is excellent for swimming and sunbathing. There are vendors, but not too many, and we love them!

657933027.name: Amazing
657933027.author: a TripAdvisor user
657933027.reviewBody: Our first visit to Guayabitos.  We walked from La Penita to Guayabitos on the beach mid morning.  what a beautiful walk and what a beautiful beach!  Nice breeze and a great feeling of airiness and freedom! Gorgeous scenery with the birds and the little food stands along the way.  Absolutely loved it!!

651485751.name: Great day trip from Guayabitos
651485751.author: a TripAdvisor user
651485751.reviewBody: Have been here many times on day trips from the Decameron resort in neighboring Guayabitos, and it\'s always well worth the quick trip.\n\nThe beach is beautiful and generally not super busy, the water is very clear, and you can usually see lots of fish without having to go way out; even saw some rays this year!

647210359.name: amazing beach
647210359.author: a TripAdvisor user
647210359.reviewBody: the Decameron los cocos has a small beach club here. We spent the day here it was really not all that busy. We swam in the ocean while the small sting rays played in the waves. This is a place well worth the visit

638006356.name: nice area
638006356.author: a TripAdvisor user
638006356.reviewBody: Beach well used, clean and lots of good restaurants line it, good place to find tours and if you like shrimp they have lots,, actually mostly seafood along here.

636876798.name: Santo Remedio Restaurant
636876798.author: a TripAdvisor user
636876798.reviewBody:
Very new and modern eatery/bar
In Los Ayala.
Great food, flavourable, varied selection and certainly reasonably priced.
Walk through the entrance into a delightfully treed rear courtyard with 
Great ambience, thoughtful lighting for evening meals. 
Staff is most accommodating.
A must visit for a great meal at very fair pricing.

625998123.name: Los ayala
625998123.author: a TripAdvisor user
625998123.reviewBody: Staying for a month with my uncle in a condo on the beach. It is warm and humid, but has cooled off mid month. It is a very nice beach, a lot of nights it rains, the water is usually not to rough unless there is a storm. The water is warm and the sand is nice, but it can get hot. Mosquitos can be bad in the evenings. Not too much to see snorkling, a few fish, you can rent a couple of jetskis or sit on kayaks, ride on a banana boat (big tube floatie pulled by a boat). There are a couple of trails in the nearby jungle/hill, which is about 4k to hike across, but parts are a bit overgrown, not a hike for the out of shape. There is a nice lookout about 2k,where you get a nice view of the ocean, another beach on the other side with bigger waves, kissing beach \'supposedly private\' near the beginning of the trail, with a \'bar\' (shack). Seen a few types of birds and lots of crabs while jogging it. The beach is not too busy during the week, but the weekends it can be packed, mostly from Guadalajara, and in mid November on, a lot of Canadians, I\'ve been told. There are a few beach bars, most are open weekends, with a couple during the week, I have had a few really good meals, fish grilled over mesquite, coconut shrimp, and a few blah meals as well. Beer for about 20 pesos, but a good margarita, I couldn\'t find, besides my own. Lots of vendors on the beach \'get used to it, \' had some great shrimp and donuts though. Some of the \'locals\' leave a mess on the beach, but the businesses send their people out to clean it up every morning. There is very little English spoken on the beach, but you can usually get by. The bathrooms leave a bit to be desired, but not too bad. Nice beach for family\'s.

620286387.name: Beautiful beach
620286387.author: a TripAdvisor user
620286387.reviewBody: This beach was gorgeous and it was fun playing in the big waves. Spent the day here with my family and we all enjoyed ourselves.

611029121.name: Try not to miss it
611029121.author: a TripAdvisor user
611029121.reviewBody: Great beach , peaceful , good food fair prices . friendly atmosphere . You can take several tours and dont miss Isla del coral.

673002757.name: Thermal Baths
673002757.author: a TripAdvisor user
673002757.reviewBody: Bit of a bumpy ride up into the mountains but beautiful scenery and the baths offer private tubs which is nice,  We used Augustin ( as recommended on Trip Advisor ) and he was excellent. Highly recommend him. His english is great and he provided the van and water for the four of us. His cell number is 322-122-6122  and after contacting him we used Whats App to update our plans.\nThere is also a 45 minute hike but you need better shoes which we did not have with us.

659947403.name: Tour with Agustin - Guayabitos Best Tours
659947403.author: a TripAdvisor user
659947403.reviewBody:
Thanks to Colette who posted above, we followed her advice and had the desk staff at the Hotel Allegra call Agustin on the number she provided (322-122-6122). He answered right away and we spoke to him and we met him down the road at our hotel and made arrangements to go out the next day. Agustin is a very pleasant person who’s English is excellent due to living over 15 years in the US. He knows the area around the thermal baths as you grew up there and showed us what remains of his grandfather’s house that we passed on the bumpy road. The thermal baths are very nice but warning the site is very much set up for Mexican tourism as much of Guayabitos is. Large families some camp in tents over night. We had our own tub with freshly supplied hot water. Really interesting how this is all set up. It is under shade and it was an overcast day so the warm tubs were very attractive. 10 year old children enjoyed themselves as well. There are some trails where you can take a 45 min hike but we did not plan for this.  Nice drive if you want to take on the countryside, vegetation, etc.

Left feeling very relaxed with nice loose muscles.

If this is not really what interests you, I still recommend you talk to Agustin as he can recommend other activities and take you out to do that.

Agustin is very honest, dependable and reliable. Fair prices. He arranged a taxi for us to the airport as well.

657271848.name: Hot springs
657271848.author: a TripAdvisor user
657271848.reviewBody: 32 separate pools in which to relax. Good price-$40 pesos per person..restaurant and bathrooms on site.

655818061.name: Absolutely wonderful and spotless
655818061.author: a TripAdvisor user
655818061.reviewBody: Yes a bit bumpy, not as bad as some report and there were some small cars up there, probably took them a bit longer to get there. We made the mistake of not looking at the reviews so had no b\'bque foods. There is a small "kiosk" on site and she can whip up some dishes.....sure smelled good.\nThere is no smell and the water flows out to the river, not the next pool.You are assigned a pool and the attendant shows you how to make it warmer. Washrooms etc spotless too.\nA great day, loved every minute

655113259.name: Difficult to find but worth the research.
655113259.author: a TripAdvisor user
655113259.reviewBody:
We drove 1 hr 30 minutes Bucerias to the hot springs. We had a terrible time because the google gps wanted us to make a hairpin turn at Las Canada driving from the south.
Even with signage there were cars stopping trying to figure it out.
Lovely clean place. Cheap beer, good Camerones. You cannot hop from one hot pool to another. You must choose one and stay there. Ours was hot on top but cold at the bottom so we were disappointed.  There are many more pools hidden in the trees.
See attached map.entry is 40 pesos

650618684.name: Great spot
650618684.author: a TripAdvisor user
650618684.reviewBody: We loved this off the beaten track hot springs. Although our pool was only warm and not hot, the staff was great and everyone got their own little pool. Signage is pretty good from the ixtapa side but most people we met came from la penita side in Nayarit. Bring your own food as they only have chips and pop.

650141643.name: Clean hot springs
650141643.author: a TripAdvisor user
650141643.reviewBody: Get there about 10 am.  You need at least 8-10 inch clearance under your car.  We hit a rock and knocked a hole in the oil pan.  I think there is a better road from Mescales.  Take your friends,chairs,picnic lunch and towels.

646168330.name: Looking for something to do?
646168330.author: a TripAdvisor user
646168330.reviewBody: Nice place to visit and stay for a few hours  . You can also camp and stay overnight. They sell food, drinks, coffee. They have individual pools, they explained to us they clean and change water often.\nThe road to get there is very rustic but worth the trip. Better if you hire a guide to take you there.

610945130.name: Out of the way and worth the effort
610945130.author: a TripAdvisor user
610945130.reviewBody: If you want to take an interesting off the beaten path drive to Aguas Termales take the road out of San Juan de Abajo.  You will appreciate your arrival and spend a day or several hours enjoying the heated water.  The spa is clean and well kept.

568183107.name: Fantastic
568183107.author: a TripAdvisor user
568183107.reviewBody: a must "experience".  The road to get there is a challange, but the pools are awesome.  Well maintained.

558592850.name: A unique experience
558592850.author: a TripAdvisor user
558592850.reviewBody: This is a great way to spend a day.  I would suggest if you are going to go with Guayabitos Best Tours.  Most tours take you there for 4-5 hours then bring you back.  This is a beautiful place with every hot tub made from local materials, and in different shapes and sizes.  But I\'m not one to spend 4-5 hours in a hot tub, in Mexico.  with Best Tours, Augustine will make a day out of it, and take to you other places after, like his home town of Fortuna.  There you will have a wonderful shrimp meal at a great price.  you can call Agustine at 322-122-6122 or meet him at his booth by Hotel Alegra.  We have used his services for 5 years and have never been disappointed.

551338519.name: Highly overrated
551338519.author: a TripAdvisor user
551338519.reviewBody: After reading all the reviews here, we decided to check this out for ourselves. We were prepared for the bad road and yes it was a bone rattler that seemed to never end. We were in an open top Jeep and covered in dust when we finally arrived. After we paid our admission we were very disappointed to find every pool was full of little kids, some in diapers and we all know what little kids do in pools. The whole trip was a huge disappointment, if you do go, don\u2019t go in the busy season.

459453417.name: Hard to get to but worth it.
459453417.author: a TripAdvisor user
459453417.reviewBody: We hired a van for a group of nine of us and it took over an hour to get there, way up in the hills.  The place is pretty well developed but most groups bring their own food and drink.  Toilets and dressing rooms available.  It\'s got easy paved paths from the parking area, and you can choose any of several dozen small pools that are of various temperatures.  Big shade trees, some BBQs, few tables of benches.  Low entry fee, parking is close, management is nice but don\'t do much.  Great place to spend a lazy afternoon with friends.

367002897.name: Ultimate Hotspring Experience
367002897.author: a TripAdvisor user
367002897.reviewBody: These hotsprings are unique and fun to go to! There are over 30 pools now where you can sit and relax and enjoy fresh clean thermal water! It is a bit of a drive and adventure to get to this place but well worth the effort. Pack a picnic and all you will need for a great day there!!!

336501228.name: Great Day Trip
336501228.author: a TripAdvisor user
336501228.reviewBody: We had a guide drive us through several small towns to the hot springs in the mountains.  It cost us 35 pesos to enter and stay as long as we wanted.  There are 15 tubs that are constantly being fed by the hot springs.  Because it is off the beaten path (1 1/2 hours out of Puerta Vallarta) it was not crowded at all.  There was one other family there.  There is food available for purchase we did not eat there but it looked home cooked and tasty.  There are pictures on the internet if you look it up.  Enjoyable for any age.  The owner also allowed you to camp there if you wanted.  Tubs were clean and the water was clear

658511191.name: An Outstanding Transportation Service!
658511191.author: a TripAdvisor user
658511191.reviewBody: I was immensely impressed with using Transportur Guayabitos for the first time. I had great email communication throughout the booking and confirmation process. Their drivers were professional, safe and courteous. I was really impressed with Antonio who showed up 15 minutes earlier than scheduled. I agree that their pick up price was higher than other sources, but you cannot beat the outstanding service.  Highly Recommended!!!

address.streetAddress: Av. Sol Nuevo # 152 Plaza Cinema Guayabitos, Int 4B

653993055.name: So dependable
653993055.author: a TripAdvisor user
653993055.reviewBody: This is the third year I have used this service they are great and so dependable to have you pick up.

address.streetAddress: Av. Sol Nuevo # 152 Plaza Cinema Guayabitos, Int 4B

635652427.name: A great way to get from the PV airport to Guayabitous.
635652427.author: a TripAdvisor user
635652427.reviewBody: Dependable , courteous, good vehicles and drivers. A little pricey. They will meet you at the airport.

address.streetAddress: Av. Sol Nuevo # 152 Plaza Cinema Guayabitos, Int 4B

565121739.name: Tequila tour
565121739.author: a TripAdvisor user
565121739.reviewBody: Had a great tour to Tequila with driver, Alejander and LaLonde, the tour guide. Lots of fun and very informative about the sites along the way, the various fruit trees and field crops. The tour took us first for a nice breakfast in Ixtlan del Rio and then off to the Tequila distillery La Cofradia and the  resort hotel de barricas. Appro 40 minute tour was very informative.Depart at 7 am and back before dark.our group of 6 would highly recommend this tour company.\nDave and Connie, Winnipeg Beach, MB, Canada. March 6,2018

address.streetAddress: Av. Sol Nuevo # 152 Plaza Cinema Guayabitos, Int 4B

553067105.name: Great start to our trip
553067105.author: a TripAdvisor user
553067105.reviewBody: after travelling all day it was such a pleasant reception we received from Gilberto and his wife, who picked up our large party in two vehicles. I had excellent correspondence with Gilberto months beforehand, as I had several questions and we treated as professionally in person as we were via email. Lovely start to our trip and worth every penny.

address.streetAddress: Av. Sol Nuevo # 152 Plaza Cinema Guayabitos, Int 4B

492494498.name: Unreliable.  Make sure you have a back up plan!
492494498.author: a TripAdvisor user
492494498.reviewBody: Did not show up at all for pre-scheduled pick up.  I was waiting 30 minutes prior to the scheduled time.  Could not get a hold of them to find out where my ride was neither via phone nor  e-mail.  Ended up having to walk with all luggage to catch an expensive  cab 8 blocks away.  Because I waited 30 minutes after the scheduled time for them, arrived late at the airport. \n\nTheir response:  The chauffeur was there 15 minutes prior to pick up (not true....it\'s an empty street....could not have missed me with all my luggage waiting).

address.streetAddress: Av. Sol Nuevo # 152 Plaza Cinema Guayabitos, Int 4B

472169769.name: Great service - will use them again!
472169769.author: a TripAdvisor user
472169769.reviewBody: Excellent communication and prices.  We will definitely use this service again.  Office location is very easy to access.

address.streetAddress: Av. Sol Nuevo # 152 Plaza Cinema Guayabitos, Int 4B

458978857.name: Safe Driver, comfortable car
458978857.author: a TripAdvisor user
458978857.reviewBody: We used this service to be picked up at the airport and to return. The driver was excellent, you could tell that he really cared about our safety. Polite and friendly, we arrived at the airport on a holiday weekend and he remained calm even though getting us close to the departures was challenging. I\'d highly recommend this service.

address.streetAddress: Av. Sol Nuevo # 152 Plaza Cinema Guayabitos, Int 4B

447189122.name: Alejandro and Miguel are the best!
447189122.author: a TripAdvisor user
447189122.reviewBody: Alejandro drove us on a couple of tours, and is so very knowledgeable about the culture, history, plants, and more.  He is reliable, and just awesome.  Great guys!

address.streetAddress: Av. Sol Nuevo # 152 Plaza Cinema Guayabitos, Int 4B

364029703.name: Mixed review
364029703.author: a TripAdvisor user
364029703.reviewBody: We booked this service because we had  8 bags. We booked a pickup at the PV airport because we were told that a person would meet us at the lobby with our name and transport us to our hotel, but a person meet us with a sign which had our name and told us that their van had broke down and we had to cross over the street and meet a taxi. That was very difficult with 8 bags. We paid for an airport pickup.  A month later my sister booked with them and I told her to confirm an airport pickup and every thing went well for her.  SO I would tell people who have not been there before to be sure to confirm ON AIRPORT PICKUP.  It works better that way.

address.streetAddress: Av. Sol Nuevo # 152 Plaza Cinema Guayabitos, Int 4B

352662644.name: on time
352662644.author: a TripAdvisor user
352662644.reviewBody: always prompt, newer vehicles and alejandro and miguel were awesome as was dalia. totally recommend this company as they will try to accommodate any request you come up with as far as a tour goes.\n

address.streetAddress: Av. Sol Nuevo # 152 Plaza Cinema Guayabitos, Int 4B

342568946.name: Really good service
342568946.author: a TripAdvisor user
342568946.reviewBody:
I booked service from the Puerto Vallarta airport to Guayabitos because of the price being so much better than anybody else.  What I didn't expect was the incredible customer service.  The day of our flight other flights to Mexico we being disrupted because of weather in other areas.  During my plane change in Phoenix I received text updates from Dalia indicating some changes to what had been previously set up.  No problem because the drivers was waiting when we arrived 30 minutes ahead of schedule.  She was tracking the flight the entire way.

Vehicles were clean and all had seat belts.  The ride to Guayabitos included a stop at Walmart.  I needed to get some pecos and the driver said the ATM at Walmart was the best option. 

I highly recommend them.

address.streetAddress: Av. Sol Nuevo # 152 Plaza Cinema Guayabitos, Int 4B

323180332.name: taxi services
323180332.author: a TripAdvisor user
323180332.reviewBody:
The good:
 - Usually clean and tidy.  
 - Usually friendly drivers who will work with your level of Espanyol.
 - Availability -- always there.
 - Price is reasonable to cheap.

The not-so-good:
 - Seat belts?  Might or might not be there.  That's the only reason my rating is not higher.

NOTE my visit was actually January to June of 2013.  May have changed since.

address.streetAddress: Av. Sol Nuevo # 152 Plaza Cinema Guayabitos, Int 4B

645344526.name: Fun and Informative  Mexican Cooking Class
645344526.author: a TripAdvisor user
645344526.reviewBody: We went to Casa Cooking by Betty last evening.  The class takes place in Betty\'s cozy little home in La Penita which is the town adjacent to Guayabitos.  You can reach Betty to book classes by going to Facebook and searching "Casa Cooking by Betty" and Messaging her through there.  The evening started with her grandmother\'s guacamole and a refreshing drink called a Cantarita which used fresh squeezed lime & orange juice, mineral water & Squirt over ice...then (optional) add tequila.  Served in her charming signature earthenware jars (a gift to her clients) and lightly rimmed with Tajin.  The main meal was Mahimahi wrapped in banana leaves with a flavorful Poblano rice side.  As she prepared our meal, she would explain not only the process but interlace stories of her childhood and learning the art of Mexican cooking (Her father was a chef and prepared meals for many famous people.) from her family members.  Betty speaks English well and has a vibrant and charming personality.  The time passed so quickly and we felt, as visitors to Mexico, that we got to truly experience the warmth and charm of the Mexican people through this gracious lady.

643652366.name: Returning for a new cooking session
643652366.author: a TripAdvisor user
643652366.reviewBody:
We have returned to learn more about authentic Mexican meal preparation. This year we enjoyed a simple but delicious guacamole and a chicken enchilada. Her ingredients are things we can buy at home which is great.  
Betty is entertaining and easy to understand and is keen to improve her English and our Spanish!
The address listed in Trip Advisor  in Guayabitos is not correct. She’s now located at her house in La Penita. 
The address I think is 18 Calle Gulf de Tehuantapec. 
We have no phone number. Another way to get there is to go south about 3 “blocks” from the Main Street intersection in La Penita. Then turn left by the “park” go 1/2 block and you are there, hopefully!!

559291778.name: A real taste of Mexico!
559291778.author: a TripAdvisor user
559291778.reviewBody: Today was my second Mexican cooking class with the beautiful and funny Betty Nu\u00f1ez in La Pe\u00f1ita. Betty packs more information about Mexican cooking as she knows it into 2 hours than you could ever hope to remember. Forget recipes as you know them and just sit back and enjoy! The food is fresh, authentic and delicious. The whole experience is made all the better because participants are packed into Betty\u2019s own kitchen in her little house with her daughter offering  a refreshing margarita to get things started. Not only do you learn from Betty but you also meet other travelers from all over. A lovely experience all round!

558717736.name: Excellent experience & Great food
558717736.author: a TripAdvisor user
558717736.reviewBody: We spent a very pleasent afternoon with Betty.  We learned about different salsas and guacamole.  The food was excellent and we all came away with some great recipes.\nThe groups she sees are about 6 people at a time so there is a lot of opportunity to ask questions

465026847.name: Warm and Wonderful
465026847.author: a TripAdvisor user
465026847.reviewBody: My friend and I decided to take a cooking class with Betty and it turned out even better than anticipated.  The atmosphere was great and the food was wonderful.  Betty\'s charm and personality made the class so comfortable it felt like being with an old friend.  Her instruction were really good and easy to understand.  \nMargarita\'s were included with the class and made by her daughter, a margarita officiado.  All in all, it was a great class.  So great that we went back the next week for another session.  We also found out that Betty caterers and ended up getting her to cater a party for our friends in the bungalows that we were staying at.  It turned out to be a great party for 40 people and everyone, and I mean everyone, enjoyed the wonderful food!  Thanks so much Betty and we will be back!

461570084.name: VIVA CASA COOKING CLASSES
461570084.author: a TripAdvisor user
461570084.reviewBody: Knowing we was going to Rincon in January I arranged for my friend and I to take a class with the delightful Betty at her cooking school.  It was one of the highlight of our trip!  My emails prior to arriving in Mexico were always promptly answered so it was a breeze to secure our places at the school.  The class was held on a Thursday which coincided with the amazing La Penita market so it made for an unforgettable day.   Betty is the consumate instructor and hostess, and her lovely daughter prepares a wicked margarita.  Her English is excellent and her cooking tips very helpful.  Our class learned how to make a very good guacamole and two different types of empanadas which we all ate with much relish at the end of the class.  They were sooo delicious that the next day my friend and I went out and bought tortilla presses because we knew we would make them back at home to remind of our wonderful time in Mexico.  The only negative thing I have to say is that there should be better lighting over the kitchen area.  It was quite dark back there so it made taking pictures rather difficult.  Other than that I give Betty five stars and encourage anyone in the area to spend a few hours having a fabulous experience.  Great job Betty!  We will return the next time we are in the area.

445411216.name: Cooking classes with Betty are fabulous!
445411216.author: a TripAdvisor user
445411216.reviewBody:
Six of us went to Betty's home to learn to cook camarones al coco, sopa de arroz a la mexicana, salsa tamarino, & guacamole con piña.  It was a fabulous experience that I highly recommend.  

Betty and her family are kind and generous people who made us feel welcome and comfortable from our arrival through to our departure.  Betty's lessons are clear, and she is very patient to explain details and to answer questions.  Her English is excellent, and her directions are easy to understand. 

Our meal was delicious, and introduced us to some flavours of Mexico that were new to us.  Betty was also happy to tell us where the best places to buy the various ingredients were in town. 

We are already planning our next excursion to her home for another lesson. 

Worth every peso!

287462478.name: Fun and informative!
287462478.author: a TripAdvisor user
287462478.reviewBody: I\'ve taken two of the Casa cooking classes.  They were fun and very informative. \nI learned quite a few trade secrets of Mexican cooking and thoroughly enjoyed my time in the kitchen there.

192177862.name: Fun and educational
192177862.author: a TripAdvisor user
192177862.reviewBody: Deb and Betty provide an authentic Mexican food experience.  This is the third year I have attended and it is a highlight of my annual trip to this area.  In the last class, we sampled empanadas which were excellent and received complete instructions to make them at home.  Class is accompanied by very excellent Margaritas.  I have also found the attendees to be very amicable and have made several friends as a result.  I have also mastered Chiles Rellenos!

654509954.name: Killer Queen!!
654509954.author: a TripAdvisor user
654509954.reviewBody: This is a great place to watch movies.  I just saw the Queen biopic \u201cBohemian Rhapsody\u201d, and it was awesome. The recreation of their set at Live Aid was spot on, including the Pepsi and beer cups on Freddy Mercury\u2019s piano. On Tuesday\u2019s afternoon they show their movies in English.  Admission is 50 pesos and you get to preselect your seats.  Be sure to bring a light jacket as the theatre is air conditioned.  Their popcorn is yummy as well.

564041869.name: Fun matinee movie
564041869.author: a TripAdvisor user
564041869.reviewBody: On certain days this movie house runs English language movies. \nOn a hot day it\'s a great place to sit in air conditioned comfort and indulge in a little escapism, ice cream cone optional!

555993452.name: Gotta Love English Tuesday\u2019s
555993452.author: a TripAdvisor user
555993452.reviewBody: We just returned from watching The Commuter with Liam Neeson, at Cinema Guayabitos.  Excellent movie!  It was \u201cEnglish Tuesday\u201d which consisted of movies in English for 35 pesos.  I love how you can reserve your seats at no extra charge.  The theatre seats are very comfortable, however, I would recommend that you bring a light overcoat or hoodie as the air conditioning can be quite chilly after coming from the outside in 28 Celsius weather.  Highly recommended!!!

547586965.name: Up to date movies, and English Tuesdays.
547586965.author: a TripAdvisor user
547586965.reviewBody: This is surprisingly a comfortable, very well air-conditioned Cinema with all day English movies on Tuesdays. We took a break from the beach and the heat in Rincon de Guayabitos one afternoon to watch a newly released movie. The theatre is reasonably priced, about half of what we would spend in Canada. The popcorn is less salty and more like home-made. If you want a sugar free pop you need to ask for a can as the fountain drinks do not have sugar free options. I like that the snacks are given in plastic trays and easy to carry into your theatre of choice, be sure to bring the tray to the attendant after the movie. The seats are comfortable, they make you choose your seat at the box office when you buy a ticket. After the movie if you need the washroom, do not go out the exit, as you will end up outside the Cinema, instead go back the way you entered the theatre you chose and the washrooms are where you gave your ticket to the attendant.

458589214.name: English Tuesday\'s
458589214.author: a TripAdvisor user
458589214.reviewBody: This theatre absolutely blows the ones back home out of the water.  On Tuesdays they show English movies for only 35 pesos, and even get to reserve your seats.  The seats in the theatre are really comfortable. I would recommend that you bring a light sweater or coat with you, as sometimes the air conditioning makes it quite cool inside.

442209854.name: If you like movies....
442209854.author: a TripAdvisor user
442209854.reviewBody: Attention anglophile North Americans, these folks run first run movies in English on Tuesdays at 1:30, usually a choice of three shows.  Very good, uncrowded seating, popcorn, candies, nachos and soda available at concession.  And it is only 35 pesos a head (more for 3D).  This might be the best deal in Mexico, try it out.

663460512.name: I love it \u2764\ufe0f\u2764\ufe0f\u2764\ufe0f
663460512.author: a TripAdvisor user
663460512.reviewBody: I love it the tour and the people was soo nice \ud83d\udc4d and the island \ud83c\udf34 was amazing \ud83d\ude09 I am COMING BACK and the beach is so clear. \u2764\ufe0f\u2764\ufe0f\u2764\ufe0f

661902039.name: Excellent visit
661902039.author: a TripAdvisor user
661902039.reviewBody: Had a very positive visit to the Coral Island, more of a family and friend outing. Great swimming and snorkeling, I highly recommend taking your own beach equipment and a small cooler with beverages. There are two small restaurants not much of a selection. Otherwise it is a beautiful place to spend the day enjoying the beach with friends and family.

661675534.name: Cheap boat tour, good snorkeling for the area
661675534.author: a TripAdvisor user
661675534.reviewBody: It\'s easy to book a boat tour -- just walk down the beach until you find someone selling them. We found someone near Tonita\'s 1 beach restaurant, near the Laureles beach walkway. We paid 250 pesos each. Keep in mind that it\'s an hour time difference from Puerto Vallarta or San Pancho, so we had to wait over an hour before the first boat trip at 10:30 am (other companies might have earlier tours). One of our fellow boat riders got sick within 25 feet of shore, so I had to ask the captain to return (I was nominated translator despite my bad Spanish). We picked up more people while on the beach, a multi-generational group from Mexico, which included a young man who thankfully spoke better English than my Spanish. Then, just as I thought we were heading to the island, Jesus turned us back to shore on a different stretch of beach to pick up a sun shirt. Finally, we started the tour which included a cruise past a protected sea turtle nesting beach and past Crab Island. We really just wanted to go snorkeling, so some of our group got a bit impatient. Finally, around 11:15 we got off at Isla Coral, which was already fairly crowded.  The water wasn\'t crowded, though, so we explored the reef with snorkel gear we brought with us from Colorado. Clarity was bad in front of the beach, but got better in either direction. It reminded me of snorkeling on the North Shore of Oahu -- more algae than live coral, but we saw trigger fish, pufferfish, spotted box fish, parrotfish, Moorish idols, and a moray eel, and lots of bright blue baby damselfish. The water was fairly warm, too, for late March. You could buy Corona Light from the beach shack for only 25 pesos (bottled water was 20, so it really wasn\'t a difficult decision). Someone was selling raw oysters and some sort of snack with salsa on it. There\'s also a casual restaurant on the island above the dock with a great view. The crowd was primarily families vacationing from other parts of Mexico and we enjoyed people watching on the beach. We stayed about 2 hours. There\'s an employee on the dock who will radio your tour company when you\'re ready to leave, then you wait for them to arrive.

657271774.name: island trip with Alicia\'s tours
657271774.author: a TripAdvisor user
657271774.reviewBody: Chacala Beach tour with Alicia\'s. Snorkeling at Coral Island on the way back. Great tour and the beach is nice.

656393088.name: Enjoyable but no live coral
656393088.author: a TripAdvisor user
656393088.reviewBody:
We took our snorkel gear on our trip and used it on on the island. Lots of fish, warm water but no live coral. 
Area is a popular tourist spot so take an early boat to the island. There is a small restaurant and hut on the island to get refreshments( beer) and food. 
Cost was quite cheap for the boat ride but can be a little rough if the waves are rough. 
As we are novice snorklers this was a safe spot to improve our skills. I would do it again but enjoyed Jamaica better for snorkeling. 
Met some people from quebec there and had a good visit with them. Everyone out there was very friendly.

646199343.name: Whales, Island, sand, and sand oh and food
646199343.author: a TripAdvisor user
646199343.reviewBody: We reserved the whale watching and Isla de Coral tour.  We had a little boat just for our party of 7.  Our guide was great giving us information about the area, telling us stories.  And then it was time to start looking for the whales.  We had an amazing show.  The whales were cooperating and got to see them several times jumping, swimming, and even "waving".  We were dropped at Isla de Coral were we snorkel and could see pretty fish, someone said she saw a turtle but we did not locate it.  The little restaurant up the hill had good food.  It got a bit crowded by the time we were leaving but we had a great time there.

645022556.name: Worth a Visit if Staying in Guayabitos!
645022556.author: a TripAdvisor user
645022556.reviewBody: Took a boat trip from Decameron Los Cocos for 250 pp. Seen turtles, stingrays & a good variety of fish. Beach was busy, however only half the people were snorkelling. Spent approximately 2 hours there.

630033452.name: Just okay
630033452.author: a TripAdvisor user
630033452.reviewBody: I guess it\'s worth checking out while here but it isn\'t really anything special. The boat tour is fun though to see all around the bay.

617769920.name: Amaizing!
617769920.author: a TripAdvisor user
617769920.reviewBody: Clear water, white sand. The boat ride is few minutes away and cheap, also include a  tour of the nearby beaches and islands . We enjoyed so much, even when the island was full.

614462316.name: \ud83d\ude09
614462316.author: a TripAdvisor user
614462316.reviewBody: Beautiful view! Clear water, visited early in the morning, only us 6 people, we enjoyed ir so much, first trip is at 10: 00 am.

572329129.name: Fantastic!.
572329129.author: a TripAdvisor user
572329129.reviewBody:
The beach here is the best in the entire riviera, 
The boat ride is only a few minutes away and is super cheap. 
Be here before the crowds because is small, they offer activities like snorkeling and scuba diving. You can buy drinks but bring yours snacks.
The beach is incredible, white sand, multicolored waters and the best views of the mountains and jungle.

571367221.name: Amazing! a must see
571367221.author: a TripAdvisor user
571367221.reviewBody: This island has the best beach water in the Riviera Nayarit, it was super clear and a little bit cold. Just get to Rincon de Guayabitos and from there get one of local boats to take you there for $200 pesos per person. They will give you a tour of the nearby beaches and islands and then they will drop you here for a couple of hour or as you prefer, just coordinate with them. \nThey do have a restaurant onsite but I will suggest just bringing your cooler and beach umbrella and stay here about three hours. \nIt is very good to do snorkel and for the young kids.

568180171.name: Happy
568180171.author: a TripAdvisor user
568180171.reviewBody: Happy to have this opportunity.  Snorkling on the west coast isn\'t great.  But the waters were calm, the variety of fish that we saw didn\'t dissappoint, transport to and from the island was excellent.

564753101.name: Great place to visit
564753101.author: a TripAdvisor user
564753101.reviewBody: I will definitely go back a second time , don\'t forget to bring your own drinks . No glass allowed  .

564041830.name: Worth a short visit
564041830.author: a TripAdvisor user
564041830.reviewBody: We dropped into Coral Island as part of the longer tour to Chacala.  Our half hour there was enough.  Dirty, crowded, and virtually no facilities.  The water was murky and the coral mostly dead.  I wouldn\'t recommend staying there all day.

561592056.name: Coral Island snorkelling/bird watching
561592056.author: a TripAdvisor user
561592056.reviewBody: We paid 200 pesos to take a water taxi to Coral Island and were there 3 hours. On the way we passed Crab Island and attempted to see Blue Footed Boobies on the back side of Coral Island. We did not have any sightings but the snorkelling was good. Lots of fishes and a statue underwater to see and generally good. Try to find shade if you can-it can be hot! Was crowded and few amenities, but we had packed snacks and water so it was good. Family in front of us brought their music, a bit loud, but ok. Overall a nice day

556114738.name: Photos online look great, reality not so much.
556114738.author: a TripAdvisor user
556114738.reviewBody:
I suspect that Isla del Coral could be a decent trip if you hit the perfect conditions and/or you have low expectations.  However, with facets of the trip being completely misrepresented (Kissing Beach, Tortuga Beach, glass-bottomed boat, restaurant semi-existent but not open, etc.) and the weather and tides not cooperating, this trip is a total bust. I'd not recommend Isla del Coral to anyone.  Especially poor at the cost of $500pp MX.

TL;DR - The details…

Read about this place before heading out for our (now) annual Buceriás trip.  We visited Isla del Coral yesterday, 23 January 2018.

Everything I'd read prior to visiting had been pretty darn positive.  There were a few negative reviews tucked in there, but they seemed to be a small minority, so I wasn't too concerned.  Whoops.

We were promised a visit to the "Kissing Beach", a glass bottomed boat with a tour of the smaller island and finally being dropped off as Isla del Coral which boasted snorkeling amongst the corals and fishes, and a small restaurant for cerveza and eats. 

The day was overcast that there was some chop to the ocean.  We boarded a very crowded boat over 60-minutes past the designated departure time and upon settling in realized there was no glass bottom-unless you count fiberglass.  The life vests were in questionable state, many showing signs of mildew and without the male end of the clip with which they could be properly secured.  This made them fragrant as well as unsafe.

The "Kissing Beach" we learned is "private" thus it was simply pointed out to us as we passed.  Everything announced while on the boat was in fast Spanish so I've really no clue as to what was said.  I relied on my wife who speaks Spanish to provide the translation about the Kissing Beach as well as any other proclamations made, of which there were few.  The smaller island which we were promised held lovely views of fish, coral and crab were non-existent as the boat just plowed on by and, with no glass bottom, would have been pointless anyway.  Tortuga Beach?  Uh, did we miss something?  Apparently as there was zero reference to it at all as we continued on.

We were soon deposited on the small dock on Isla del Coral with questionable snorkeling gear and walked over to the beach.  For a national natural reserve, it is a disgrace.  Overall, it feels in a state of disrepair and while there are many signs reminding not to litter, garbage abounds.  The tables, chairs and umbrellas are all worse for wear.  Crossing by to the beach one passes a rental hut and the path up to the restaurant.  It smelled like a septic field.

Once one finally gets to the beach, it is very small.  This will be exacerbated by the tides.  It is very clear at this point that, in order to enjoy any snorkeling or time on the beach, you will need to ensure the seas are very calm and you go at low tide.  Sadly, for us, we hit neither.  The tide was high and the chop we experienced on the mainland carried over to the island making the turbidity quite great and navigating through the coral for an attempt at snorkeling perilous.  

The amount of exposed beach was minimal due to the tides and occasional waves almost reached the walls of the island.  We also noted that even had the tide been farther out, there is more rock covering portions of the beach than pictures previous of the beach seen online indicated.  Combined together, there wasn't much sandy beach to be had.

You'll need to keep possessions on your person or find a ledge on the island's rock walls to place your stuff.  As per another review, many of these rock walls are white with guano so careful what you touch or where you place your bags.  Should you find a nice ledge sans poop on which to place your belongings, be careful should you use bare hands to brush off some of the dead leaves and other detritus.  There are small ants in there with a very nice bite. Ouch!

After 40-50 minutes analyzing the situation and positioning our belongings, we gave up and decided to retire to the restaurant and have a few beers while waiting for the return boat as there was nothing else to do.  We hiked past the decrepit tables and chairs for rent and up the path to the restaurant to discover that it was locked up and closed.  While there did appear signs that it is still in use, at least occasionally, there were no hours of operations posted.

Returning down the path to the rental hut, we found that they sell snacks and beverages, including beer.  Corona Light in a can is the sole option and $25 MX.  We purchased our beer and trodded back to the restaurant to await the boat that would return us to the mainland.  Half-way through our beers, we saw the boat approach and scurried down to the dock to hop aboard, happy not to have to wait any longer in this place.  

At the dock, people were dis-embarking after an uneventful trip whale watching and we were initially told we would need to wait another hour on the island to return.  Thankfully, my wife can be pretty convincing and with her grasp of the Spanish language was able to get us onto the boat and mainland bound.  We had a good laugh on the boat about our (mis-) adventure while the boat pilot blasted local tunes over the speaker system.

We soon hit the mainland, left the boat and, after a long walk on the beach, grabbed better beer, tacos and settled into the car to return to Buceriás.

554650270.name: Great Fun
554650270.author: a TripAdvisor user
554650270.reviewBody: Had an amazing time at Isla de coral. Went around noon and it was already kinda packed. But I went to get into the water not lounge and watch. The rest of the family rented some chairs and an umbrella. I would recommend snorkeling gear. You get to see some really neat fish below. Super warm waters. We did not eat the restaurant as we brought our own food. Go to enjoy yourself and try not to worry about the crowd. it is kind of busy but most are lounging so it makes it fun for the rest of us who like to go for a swim.

547586167.name: Enjoyed a visit to the Isla de Coral.
547586167.author: a TripAdvisor user
547586167.reviewBody: Took a refreshing boat ride with a glass bottom boat from the beach, literally you step onto the boat from the water\'s edge, we took the tour from in front of the Decameron Los Cocos, in Rincon de Guayabitos, for $14 Canadian, to the Isla de Coral. The boat driver took us on a bit of a scenic tour past Los Ayala, Turtle Beach,  and Kissing Beach and on to the destination. There is a dock at Coral Island and lots of helping hands to get off the boat. Having the glass bottom we did see fish in the water by the island. Once off the boat its a primitive path to the sandy beach, with rentals available for tables, chairs, umbrellas. Not much shade but we managed to find a shady corner of rock face on the beach. The entry into the water off the beach is sandy but also is full of rocks, and you have to float over the rocks  to begin snorkelling. There were a small variety of fish to see, it was worth the visit. We brought our own water and sandwiches so we did not need to buy anything at the snack area which I\'m not sure is open every day. The boat driver arranges with you a time for pick up, usually 3 hours after drop off and announces his arrival on a blow horn to take you back to Guayabitos. I am glad we were able to see the area for a reasonable price.

541588106.name: Overrated Tourist Trap
541588106.author: a TripAdvisor user
541588106.reviewBody: For the $300 pesos per person for this, it was poor value in my opinion. It did include rental of mask and snorkels each, but the value just isn\'t there.  Maybe for half the price I would give it one more star. The vendors sell this along the beach, so the prices are fixed for most of the tourists. However, I did see a Mexican tourist ask for a snorkel and mask at the last minute and the "Spanish only speaking boat skipper" got the man a set for a fraction of the price we paid.  The trip included a quick fly by the next two beach areas before a swing by the smaller island to view the bird life and a quick peek through the glass bottom of the boat. As for the island itself, the fish were few and far between as the tide was pulling and the water was cloudy. You must be careful not to rake your body over the coral reefs. Rentals of chairs and tables in the shade for an additional $100 pesos. A snack shack and more snorkel rentals are available on the isle, but I didn\'t utilize either of these. Anyhow, I would skip this and put my spending money towards something else.

540994679.name: If you have the time is a must
540994679.author: a TripAdvisor user
540994679.reviewBody: Beautiful place but not much to do except swim or snorkel . The restaurant on top is below average the restrooms are dirty. The only advantage is that you can bring your own beverages.

523811823.name: See the beach from afar
523811823.author: a TripAdvisor user
523811823.reviewBody: My daughter and I made a day of this trip to the island park. The trip over was great, a real experience for all . You could stay as long as you wanted, I thought this was an excellent way to runner trip. Lots to see and enjoy, bring your suits and towels .the water was wonderful. It was so clean! We enjoyed the walk along this beach. The cafe was interesting, we got help with the menu. It really is a local spot, but a real learning experience.  Everyone is very helpful.  The only thing that didn\'t sit well with me was they wanted rental fees for the table and chairs. I can see it for the water sports!!

480679354.name: Wonderful kayak destination
480679354.author: a TripAdvisor user
480679354.reviewBody: I\'ve kayaked to the Island several times over the last 10 years.  Its a beautiful beach to sun on, but don\'t expect to have it to yourself.  Good snorkeling - bring your gear.  You can rent a guide to take you over for the day.  But better to kayak over yourself, and paddle around the island and the bay.

477822561.name: PARADISE
477822561.author: a TripAdvisor user
477822561.reviewBody: Get on a boat and head out to Isla de Coral. Go and enjoy a nice lunch or dinner at the small island situated in the pacific ocean. You can enjoy the beautiful view from there of the ocean, Rincon de Guayabitos beach and all the glorious nature Nayarit has to offer.

473636872.name: Don\'t bother snorkeling, dead coral reef, few fish, 100 pesos to rent a table
473636872.author: a TripAdvisor user
473636872.reviewBody: A so-called protected marine park. Poor facilities,charged 100 pesos for use of a table and chairs. People who snorkelled saw few fish, a dead coral reef and were bothered by jellyfish. Don\'t bother.

470972259.name: Come visit for the view
470972259.author: a TripAdvisor user
470972259.reviewBody:
The place has a great view. Enjoy some beers on the beach relaxing and watching time go by with a fantastic view. If you want to go into the water, you will see that the current is strong and there are many rocks underneath the water: result is you won't enjoy it. Snorkeling is challenging, as the visibility is poor. There are some fishes and things to see, but it's too much effort.

Kids will have fun playing in the sand with all the different kinds of rocks around.

Bottom line: stay out of the water but do enjoy the magnificent views!!  :)

470447939.name: Bring everything you need
470447939.author: a TripAdvisor user
470447939.reviewBody: Isla de Coral has a relatively small beach with absolutely no shade. Locals bring their own umbrellas. You can rent them along with some chairs and tables but they are very expensive. \n\nThere were hundreds of sea birds flying overhead and lots of guano on the rocks which really smelled bad! We snorkelled over some coral, not very impressive and the marine life was far and few between.

468681333.name: Quick snorkel at Isla de Coral
468681333.author: a TripAdvisor user
468681333.reviewBody: As part of a day-long excursion we spent about an hour at Isla de Coral. The snorkeling there was pretty good, lots of fish, though very little coral, mostly rocks. Great place for bird-watching, too, thousands of seabirds around.

459795043.name: Close snorkel adventure
459795043.author: a TripAdvisor user
459795043.reviewBody: Most water tours in the area will end at Coral island.  This is close to Guayabitos for a little snorkeling

459452501.name: Catch a boat in Guayabitos
459452501.author: a TripAdvisor user
459452501.reviewBody: We stopped off here on a whale watching trip out of one of the restaurants at the south end of Guayabitos.  They also offer day trips to this small off-shore island where the frigate birds roost.  \n\nBring everything you\'ll want for a whole day.  There\'s nothing to buy out here since the cafe was closed for lack of water.  Better snorkeling than anywhere on the mainland.  A nice peaceful place to hang out far from the madding crowds that can clog the sand on holiday weekends.

456455407.name: Amazing fish well worth the trip
456455407.author: a TripAdvisor user
456455407.reviewBody: We go out at least once every time we go to Guayabitos.  You can ask them to leave you all day if you want.  They will come back and get you at a specified time if you want to stay longer than what they usually leave you.  Take your own gear though as what they rent is not the best of quality.  Under the bridge is one of the best places to a lot of fish. Be sure to try it out as it is not expensive.  Remember, you can always dicker a bit.

455086797.name: Rincon in my heart
455086797.author: a TripAdvisor user
455086797.reviewBody: Beautiful peaceful and warm Sands. Cheap yummy food.  I never wanted to leave. Great stop before Altavista petroglific adventure

451908266.name: Very relaxing way to spend the afternoon
451908266.author: a TripAdvisor user
451908266.reviewBody: It was our second time going out to Isla de Coral....very beautiful!  There is also a little restaurant on the island if you want lunch.  We opted to have a little snack at the snack bar down at the beach....for 50 pesos you can have a wonderful seafood mix on a tortilla shell with chips and a beer!  Recommend bringing your own snorkel and mask if you want to snorkel....beautiful assortment of fish to see!\n

449671876.name: Visit - Worth Every cent, beautiful beach, great for snorkeling
449671876.author: a TripAdvisor user
449671876.reviewBody: The beach at the island is beautiful. White Sand, Transparent water, lots of fish to watch. We stopped by the island for only 1.5 hours. wish it would have been at least twice the ammount. Beautiful place.

443540363.name: gorgeous!
443540363.author: a TripAdvisor user
443540363.reviewBody: well worth a trip - nice snorkeling, clean water, beautiful - restaurant not so great - take money for the extras like table rental - can rent snorkel gear there or pre-arrange with any number of tour operators/boats in the area - an easy trip,  I would go back often if staying
